list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I usually have only a snack at lunchtime
(also adjective) We had a snack lunch in the pub.

list_ex_of_english: Pubs will be able to expand to provide more services and meals, snacks and refreshments will be available all day long.
As to the restrictions on snacks and meals, the change in the order seems minimal.
The important aspect of flexible hours is the increase in other forms of business in public houses—meals, snacks and coffee—and is one reason why additional employees will be required.
The machines on each floor offer a range of both hot and cold drinks while light snacks such as sandwiches, crisps and confectionery are available.
With this interpretation in mind, the following order relation on snacks is easy to understand.
The remainder at present serve snacks but provision for serving full meals is under construction at three and in the planning stage at two.
The master usually owns and manages the kissa, and is often the sole employee, serving drinks, small snacks, and most importantly, controlling the selection of music for his clientele.
However, the mid-morning snacks were usually nothing that we would recognise as nutritionally adequate.
